question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 1 Which one is an intraperitoneal organ?
explanation: The spleen is an intraperitoneal organ, meaning it is completely surrounded by peritoneum.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 2 Where is the location of the stomach in the abdomen?
explanation: The stomach is primarily located in the epigastric region of the abdomen.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 3 General sensation from the skin and oral mucosa of the cheeks is carried by which one?
options: Buccal branch of the mandibular nerve
answerText: Buccal branch of the mandibular nerve
explanation: The buccal branch of the mandibular nerve (V3) provides sensory innervation to the skin and oral mucosa of the cheeks.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 4 Which nerve is for innervation of the mylohyoid muscle?
explanation: The mylohyoid muscle is innervated by the mylohyoid branch of the mandibular nerve (V3).

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 5 Which muscle of the tongue is innervated by the vagus nerve?
explanation: The palatoglossus muscle is unique as it is the only tongue muscle innervated by the vagus nerve (CN X).

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 6 General sensory innervation from the anterior two-thirds or oral part of the tongue is carried by which one?
explanation: The lingual nerve, a branch of the mandibular nerve (V3), carries general sensory information from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 7 Which muscle of the soft palate is innervated by the mandibular nerve?
explanation: The tensor veli palatini muscle is innervated by the mandibular nerve (V3).

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 8 Greater palatine artery is a branch of which one?
explanation: The greater palatine artery is a branch of the maxillary artery.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 9 Opening of the parotid duct is at the level of…
explanation: The parotid duct opens into the oral cavity opposite the second upper molar tooth.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 10 Parasympathetic innervation of the sublingual gland is by which one?
explanation: The parasympathetic innervation of the sublingual gland is through the facial nerve via the chorda tympani.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 11 Which one is in the anterior sheath of the rectus muscle?
explanation: The pyramidalis muscle is located in the anterior sheath of the rectus abdominis muscle.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 12 Where is the location of the bare area of the liver?
explanation: The bare area of the liver is located on the posterior surface, in direct contact with the diaphragm.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 13 Which one is a superficial fatty layer of the superficial fascia of the abdomen?
explanation: Camper’s fascia is the superficial fatty layer of the superficial fascia in the abdomen.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 14 Which one is located in the free border of the lesser omentum?
explanation: The common bile duct is located in the free border of the lesser omentum.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 15 Diaphragmatic surface of the spleen is covered by:
explanation: The diaphragmatic surface of the spleen is covered by ribs 9, 10, and 11.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 16 Ileocolic artery is a branch of the:
explanation: The ileocolic artery is a branch of the superior mesenteric artery.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 17 Which one is formed by superior mesenteric and splenic veins posterior to the neck of the pancreas?
explanation: The portal vein is formed by the union of the superior mesenteric vein and splenic vein posterior to the neck of the pancreas.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 18 Which one is retroperitoneal?
explanation: The descending colon is a retroperitoneal organ.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 19 Floor of the inguinal canal is formed by:
explanation: The floor of the inguinal canal is formed by the inguinal ligament.

question: First Batch (2024-10-2) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 20 Inferior rectal artery is a branch of the:
explanation: The inferior rectal artery is a branch of the internal pudendal artery.
